posts.post_content: Surprisingly effective. Throw him down, let your opponents forget about him, counts towards his own metal-craft. I run him in a Jor Kadeen EDH deck and thanks to artifact lands he's pretty much always a 5/5 for 4, and gets beefed up by not only Jor but Tempered Steel as well. Very solid card and I'm never disappointed to draw this guy.
posts.html:

I run him in a Jor Kadeen EDH deck and thanks to artifact lands he's pretty much always a 5/5 for 4, and gets beefed up by not only Jor but Tempered Steel as well. Very solid card and I'm never disappointed to draw this guy.

posts.post_content: [Bosh, Iron Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bosh, Iron Golem ) , what has time done to you?
posts.html:
Bosh, Iron Golem , what has time done to you?
Report Abuse  
Posted By: KurtX22 (5/6/2011 4:33:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ BlaveFlopata
  
   
Nope, it doesn't work that way. Summoning sickness looks at whether permanent was here at your upkeep, and not at whether it came into play as a creature. So he won't be able to attack on turn he came into play.
  
Still, he's one big golem, and metalcraft isn't too hard to activate.
posts.html:
@ BlaveFlopata

Nope, it doesn't work that way. Summoning sickness looks at whether permanent was here at your upkeep, and not at whether it came into play as a creature. So he won't be able to attack on turn he came into play.
Still, he's one big golem, and metalcraft isn't too hard to activate.

posts.post_content:
I don't like this guy in draft anymore... Too easy to shit it down with a [Blight Mamba](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blight Mamba), [Wall of Tanglecord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Tanglecord) or instant-speed artifact disruption.   
  
The game really is to the point that a generic 5/5 for 4 just isn't all that valuable anymore...
